snippet: Mr. Morsi, the deposed president, was sentenced after being convicted of charges stemming from a night of bloody street fighting between his supporters and opponents in 2012.
abstract: Egyptian court sentences deposed president Mohamed Morsi to 20 years in prison; he was ousted by military in 2013 and convicted of inciting street violence.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MERNA THOMAS

lead_paragraph: Mr. Morsi, the deposed president, was sentenced after being convicted of charges stemming from a night of bloody street fighting between his supporters and opponents in 2012.

headline.main: Egyptian Court Sentences Mohamed Morsi to 20 Years in Prison
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Leader Deposed by Army in ’13 Gets a 20-Year Prison Term
